venue.name: Microsoft New England Research & Development Center (NERD)

item.description:
April Lean Workshop

 

 

6:30pm - Early Bird Presentation: Customer Development 101, with John Prendergast
 
For those new to the concepts of Customer Development and The Lean Startup, John Prendergast, Organizer of the LSC Boston Meetup and CEO of BlueLeaf.com will talk about the basics of customer development and lean startups at 6:30pm. Come to listen to John speak, or hang out and network over pizza!

 

7:00pm - Elizabeth Yin, Co-Founder of LaunchBit presents "How to recruit and interview potential customers."

Have a great web business idea & don't know how to code? LaunchBit will teach you how to launch your idea with 3rd party tools and skills you already have.

Elizabeth Yin is a co-founder of LaunchBit, which has tools and resources to help new web  entrepreneurs get their first customers and validate their markets.  She previously worked at Google as a Product Marketing Manager.  She holds a BS in Electrical Engineering from Stanford and an MBA from MIT Sloan.

 

 

7:50pm - Rob Fan, Co-Founder and CTO, Sharethrough

Sharethrough is the leading social video seeding and marketing platform that guarantees views for branded content. Rob is the co-founder and leads all product and technology strategy for the company. He is a practitioner, student and teacher of the “lean startup” methodology. In his spare time, Rob, hacks and plays with new technology and advises early-stage startups about the successes and pitfalls he has learned thus far. As an early adopter of the Facebook platform, Rob was one of the teaching assistants for the first-ever "Facebook Class." Rob holds a BS in Electrical Engineering from Johns Hopkins University and a MS in Management Science and Engineering from Stanford University.
item.name: Lean Startup Circle Boston April Meetup
